channel.title: Just JZ
channel.itunes:author: JZ Styles
channel.description: Just JZ is hosted by Jessi Ngatikaura (jz.styles/@justjessiiii). Jessi Ngatikaura lives in Utah and owns a successful salon, JZ Styles Salon, that has grown into a country wide brand that offers hair extensions, in person and online education, a hair school and now a podcast! Jessi is passionate about creating a community for stylist's to uplift and support each other and strives for that in everything she does. Follow along as we talk all things hair, beauty, business lifestyle and more! New episodes every Friday! Follow Us On Instagram: @jzstyles.co, @jz.styles, @jzacademy, @justjessiiii

item.description:

FOLLOW US!

item.title: 3 Characteristics You Need To Make It In The Beauty Industry
item.description:
Today's episode is a solo Jessi one! She talks about 3 characteristics it's important to have to make it in the beauty industry today. There are so many wonderful things about our industry but it can be cut throat too and these 3 traits will help you make it through when times get tough.

item.title: Industry Hardships + Mental Health
item.description:
WE'RE BACK BABY!! We are so excited to be back with the podcast! In this first episode back we talk about industry hardships and taking care of your mental health during this time of year. We also talk about Jessi getting shamed about her baby names aaaand a car accident happens outside of our building in the middle of recording. It's never a dull moment at JZ!

item.itunes:title: Jamie Dana: The Business Glow-Up
item.title: Jamie Dana: The Business Glow-Up
item.description: We're back with stylist and social media ninja, Jamie Dana! She is a hairstylist turned business owner and helps other stylists build a business and life they love using Instagram. She's kind of a big deal and has grown her brand through Youtube, Instagram, and online courses. She's dropping her knowledge here and letting us in on all her secrets to growing a thriving brand online!

item.itunes:title: Talking Taylor: Speak Now
item.title: Talking Taylor: Speak Now
item.description: It's October, which is almost Halloween, and that means it's basically Christmas - and we are cruising through our Taylor discography! We're talking about Speak Now, Taylor's 3rd album and one she wrote entirely by herself. We all know Taylor is in the middle of re-recording her albums and releasing them in their original intended glory (RED is dropping in November) but for some reason, Speak Now is getting skipped over. (1989 will be next). However, this album was one of her most pivotal and one that meant something different to each one of us. Listen along as we discuss the album notes, songs (and words) to live by, and why Speak Now is an album that will forever go down as our favorite.

item.itunes:title: Life Advice
item.title: Life Advice
item.description: We may not be experts at everything but we're here to give you our opinions (and hopefully some sound life advice) regarding all of your biggest life questions! From letting go of the bitterness of divorce and dating must-haves to our least favorite things about each other and what TV show Stew wants to live in full time. It's good stuff! Tune in and hopefully, you'll snag a little wisdom along the way!

item.itunes:author: JZ Styles

item.itunes:title: Astrology
item.title: Astrology
item.description: When someone asks you "What's your sign?" it's more than likely they're asking you to share your sun sign, which indicates where the sun was located when you were born. And for a lot of us, that's as much as we know about astrology. So today we're giving you a crash course in all your personalities with our friend Bailee Pili @baileepili. The realm of astrology can appear vast and daunting. Luckily, there's an entry point to be found for even the greenest beginner. So buckle up, call your mom to find out what time you were born, and then get close because we're about to explain why you are the way you are - and if everything you manifest today was written in the stars!

item.itunes:title: The Assistant
item.title: The Assistant
item.description: Easily our most exhaustive topic, assisting is the reality of our day-to-day in the salon. It's where Stew started and it's really where a hair stylist's journey begins. They are your right hand - they style, wash, dry, ready supplies we're going to use on a client - and their responsibilities grow as their talent and skillset increase. We're sharing what our assistants do, the behind-the-scenes of our very well-known assistant program, and everything you need to know about hiring or becoming an assistant.

item.itunes:title: What I Wish My Clients Knew
item.title: What I Wish My Clients Knew
item.description: As stylists, we all have different training, diverse client bases, and encounter so many things in the salon on a day-to-day basis. But lately, we've been talking about the things we wish our clients knew that would make our jobs as hair stylists a little easier. Asking us to bend the rules or just understanding how much energy we put into each client would go a long way. Stew and Jessi each picked the 3 things they wish their clients knew before sitting down in their chair!

item.itunes:title: MONEY WITH MICHELLE: Investing
item.title: MONEY WITH MICHELLE: Investing
item.description: We're back with one of our favorite regulars, Michelle! Michelle aka Daddy Styles is talking to us today about investing. Having money or keeping a hold of your money is one thing but having your money work for you is a whole other ball game. Michelle breaks down the traditional investment vehicles most people know: 401K, Roth IRA, and so many more. He shows us that as money holders, we have options. And as entrepreneurs, the best time to put our money to work for us is now. And believe it or not, he may have gotten Stew to give up store-bought coffee and it just might make him a millionaire! This is an episode you're not gonna want to miss.

item.itunes:title: Salon Horror Stories Pt. 2
item.title: Salon Horror Stories Pt. 2
item.description: We asked our audience to send in their own salon horror stories and you guys DELIVERED! From chemical haircuts to clients who get physical when things don't go their way, our listeners have been put through the wringer. You're all definitely going to heaven and probably got extra bonus points for dealing with the coworker from hell. And above all, know you're not alone! This business is rough and there is a ton of pressure, but that's because it's creating a bunch of diamonds. So sit back, get comfy, and listen as hairstylists across the U.S. share tales of their own personal hells.

We imagine that this is a pretty standard issue whether you went to hair school or business school. Today we sit down with fellow stylist Kaylee and talk about the 5 things we wish we would have learned in hair school!

item.itunes:title: Misconceptions Of A Stylist
item.title: Misconceptions Of A Stylist
item.description: $24,000 is the average income of a hairstylist but believing that's all you're worth is just one of the many misconceptions about our industry. From not making good money to it not being a serious career, there are so many untruths out there. We're talking about the friend that always asks for a discount, the client that asks if you can just "slip them in" last minute, and the catty gossip that is non-stop. It's time to elevate your craft and ditch those misconceptions that are holding you back!

item.itunes:title: Talking Taylor: Fearless
item.title: Talking Taylor: Fearless
item.description: Released April 9th, Taylor’s re-record of her breakthrough 2008 album was easily the most anticipated album of 2021 for legions if Swifties! We’re dissecting everything on the album from lyrics, to new songs, and more! We’ve got resident Swiftie Kate Racker Ackerman who puts us all to shame with her extensive Taylor knowledge. From Taylor teasing the release (she capitalized random letters in the text that when strung together spelled out “APRIL 9” and 4+9=13, her lucky number) to the date she announced it (February 11 and 2+11=13). And who could ignore the fact that 2021 marks 13 years since the original Fearless was released…this is an episode you’re not going to want to miss.

We’re dissecting everything on the album from lyrics, to new songs, and more! We’ve got resident Swiftie Kate Racker Ackerman who puts us all to shame with her extensive Taylor knowledge. From Taylor teasing the release (she capitalized random letters in the text that when strung together spelled out “APRIL 9” and 4+9=13, her lucky number) to the date she announced it (February 11 and 2+11=13). And who could ignore the fact that 2021 marks 13 years since the original Fearless was released…this is an episode you’re not going to want to miss.
item.itunes:author: JZ Styles

item.itunes:title: I Love My Job But…Guest Courtney Campbell
item.title: I Love My Job But…Guest Courtney Campbell
item.description:
Most of us love our jobs but….we all have those things we don’t love about the work that enables us to pay our bills. What if it goes deeper? What if your current occupation just isn’t the perfect fit? 

Introducing our new series “I Love My Job, but…” where we discuss the realities of the “JOB” in any career path and those things that make the experience less than perfect. Today we have one of our JZ Styles stylists, Courtney Campbell, discussing the hair industry and why she’s chosen to make a switch!

item.description: We're taking it back to the time where you could write into your trusty pals Abby and Ann for advice on life's toughest situations and dropping unsolicited advice for work, life, and everything in between. But unlike real-life twin sisters and advice column rivals "Dear Abby" and "Ask Ann Landers," we're putting our heads together to bring you the best of both of our combined experiences and dropping it on you like it's HOT!

item.itunes:title: Dream Coaching with Tara Kirby
item.title: Dream Coaching with Tara Kirby
item.description: Are you ready to create clarity, build confidence, and make cash through your business? Tara Kirby helps entrepreneurs do all 3 with her wildly successful DREAM Method coaching. Tara has done and seen it all. Through her extensive entrepreneurial journey, Tara was helping others succeed in their businesses but wanted to see that same type of success for herself. After quitting everything and pulling back for 6 months, Tara developed the DREAM Method Coaching which teaches female entrepreneurs how they can have the business, the babies, and the beach house!

item.itunes:title: Talking Taylor - Track 5
item.title: Talking Taylor - Track 5
item.description: Taylor Swift is nothing if not consistent. Plus our girl loves symbolism, hidden meanings, and Easter eggs. She's got a serious obsession with the hour of 2:00 AM, is a big fan of adding scripted interludes in all of her biggest hits, and the one all Swifties know and love her for, the legendary track five. What's the significance of Track 5 in Taylor Swift's albums? Track 5 on Taylor's albums are like the deepest, most personal page in her journals. She even put out a whole merch collection based on the track number. Taylor says, "I didn’t realize I was doing this, but as I was making albums, I guess I was just kind of putting a very vulnerable, personal, honest, emotional song as track five. So because you noticed this, I kind of started to put the songs that were really honest, emotional, vulnerable, and personal as track five." So we're diving deep and giving you our hot take on all things Track 5.

item.itunes:title: Entrepreneurship with Ty Coy
item.title: Entrepreneurship with Ty Coy
item.description: No one is as multi-talented and has such a diverse entrepreneurial background as Ty Coy. Ty has had quite the journey and at 26, he has run many businesses and has worn many hats. Ty is the talent behind most of the JZ Styles Co videos and we most recently worked together on The Beauty School Series *launching soon*. We talk about his burning passion to create and his ability to figure anything out. We also talk about his strange link to the Fast & Furious franchise, his love of clothing, and how the man-with-the-plan is planning on winging it when his baby is born! Ty is the CEO of Rogue Film Productions and most recently launched LAKI, a premium activewear company, with his wife! He comes from strong entrepreneurial stock and he's taking us along his journey and talking to us about failure and success and everything in between.

item.itunes:title: Talking T-Swift
item.title: Talking T-Swift
item.description: Today we're discussing cat-loving, Grammy-winning wonder, Taylor Swift and flexing our "Swifty" fan status! We're discussing all albums from her eponymous 'Taylor Swift' to the albums 'Evermore' and 'Folklore' that made 2020 bearable. Joining us is podcast producer extroidinaire, Kaylee Moore, the ultimate Taylor Swift fan! We're going album by album and disecting the songs that got us through breakups, carried us through a pandemic, and how Taylor has evolved as a person, and how those changes are reflected in her work. Buckle up, Swifties! This episode is for you...are you ready for it?

item.title: MONEY WITH MICHELLE: The Big Picture of Money Management
item.description: Money with Michelle aka Tim Draper is the sleeper hit of the Just Z podcast and we couldn't be more excited to welcome Michelle back to talk all about the big picture of Money Management. Spending less than you make, automation, investing 101, and where to even start are just a few of the nuggets of wisdom that Michelle has shared with us. And today he's talking about limited income, building an emergency fund, investing, why buying a brand new car is a bad idea, and everything in between!

item.description: "You get what you work for and not what you wish for" has been Jessi and Stew's mantra for the last couple of years and they decided to dedicate this entire season to help listeners understand what it means to be a Goal Getter and how you can achieve the career and life of your dreams! And that means mastering the practice of turning thoughts into ideas and turning those ideas into actions. Jessi and Stew are sharing their secrets and the steps they take to S.M.A.R.T goal-setting.

item.itunes:title: Imposter Syndrome and Dealing with Insecurities
item.title: Imposter Syndrome and Dealing with Insecurities
item.description: Feeling insecure or dealing with feelings of doubt and inadequacy often feel like they're just part of the job as an adult. Jessi and Stew discuss how they often feel insecure in their work and home life and the struggles they face as they live out both on social media and more. From traveling and doing classes, to raising babies, those moments of doubt and feeling less-than creep in and can really harm if not identified early, and Jessi and Stew share how they turn those moments around, feel value, and identify their strengths and importance as humans!

item.title: The Glamorous Life of A Hairstylist w/ @AlexPardashian
item.description: There's almost no one who personifies glamour more than this week's guest, Alex "Pardashian" Pardoe, but this hairstylist works just as hard as he plays! Alex is one of the most down-to-earth persons you will ever meet but who describes himself as "Boujee by birth, ratchet by choice" and is definitely one of our top 5 interviews! This pre-covid jetsetter pulls back the curtain to tell us how he works (20 clients in 1 day?!?), his secret bread and butter clients, and how everything you see on the 'Gram isn't the whole story. Tune into today's episode to learn what Kim K thinks about his tattoo of her crying face emoji, his tips for running a salon and building a business, and the only service that takes you from a Toyota Corolla to a Rolls Royce in 1 salon visit!

item.title: MONEY WITH MICHELLE!
item.description: In today’s episode Jessi and Stew interview Jessi’s dad and this episode is all about moneyyy! Meet Daddy Styles aka "Michelle" Tim Draper, my dad and business partner who handles everything financial at JZ Styles! While a lot of businesses, especially salons, suffered in 2020, JZ Styles Co was able to not only stay alive in 2020 but totally THRIVE thanks to his money management and smarts! With tax season right around the corner, Tim is dispensing GOLD and sharing how stylists, or any entrepreneur, can save money, manage money, and what you can and CAN'T write off throughout the year! This is episode 1 of "Money With Michelle" and we hope you love it so we can make it a regular series on the pod!

item.itunes:title: POPPYCOCK! New Couples + Breakups
item.title: POPPYCOCK! New Couples + Breakups
item.description: Welcome to poppycock! This is a new segment we're doing on the podcast where Jessi and Stew talk poppycock (nonsense) about things going on in the world, pop culture or the industry. We hope you enjoy this first episode! Short episodes coming every Tuesday. In this episode, they chat about the unlikely pairing of Kourtney Kardashian and Blink 182 drummer Travis Barker. And we also talk about the shocking (or not so shocking) break up between Bachelorette Clare Crawley and Dale Moss. Join us as we talk poppycock!

item.description:

Market Parters for this company have been pushing this product online for years, and there have been recent headlines about customer complaints and claims that have lead to legal battles. Jessi and Stew give their thoughts on it and also read other stylist's opinions they have gathered as well.
